intro: Crepis obtusissima, commonly known as the bluntleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, rounded leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a single head, which is a common feature among members of its family. It is native to Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. Crepis obtusissima is a perennial plant that thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
